reviews.review: Honestly? A really fresh take on the half-life story. Grew up playing half-life and it's sequels but never bothered with these early expansions, the other of course being blue shift. (I recommend this over blue shift tbh) But this has new weapons, a different perspective to see through and project onto and strangely enough, new enemies that we never again see in the story from then on, was really surprised by all the differing content in this game. And these are still dirt cheap so if you want more from the black mesa facility, chuck a couple bucks towards this and blue shift for a fun and interesting experience!
I fixed a mouse problem I had, this game is good.

This game is difficult but really good.












































john small

Oh boy Lets get over this masterpiece ;-;
Pros
+ An amazing campaign
+ Coolest and overlooked protagonist
+ Awesome Weapons
+ The Story 
+ Cool to see black mesa from another perspective
Cons
- Pretty short
- The final boss being kind of easier then ninilanth in HL1
Well thats my review. i would recommend this game to any half life fan . Quite cheap for an amazing expansion like this. Overall ill give this game a 10/10
Really enjoyed playing this add on for the marines perspective of half- life and the new types of weapons introduced to the series, but still better then blue shift.
Good chapter in the Half-Life universe.
Nice expansion, gives a whole new perspective to the black mesa accident
This is the best of the Half-Life 1 expansions, some great new weapons and enemies but still feels familiar.
Adrian is like Gordon, but he's just a U.S. Marine that he's not part of Black Mesa.
Get this as part of the Valve Mega pack and play it if you feel like it. Having just completed it, I can say that it has the same vibe as half life 1 but is shorter with harder enemies.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is the first expansion of Half-Life cause you play as Adrian Shepard of the HECU Marines & It's the best expansion of Half-Life cause Blue Shift is sometimes a glitching mess when you first play that, but I love Opposing Force so much. I highly recommend getting Opposing Force.

Como una expansi√≥n para Half Life, Opposing Force excede en lo que se propone, tomando el gameplay de Half Life y agregandole m√°s armas, m√°s enemigos, y una nueva historia paralela a la de Gordon Freeman, un poco dificil para el final, pero para nada de menor calidad a la campa√±a del Half Life 1 original.
gran juego una que jugue en mi favorito

Opposing Force maintains Half-Life's quality while offering a different perspective and introducing new characters, weapons, enemies, and mechanics. My only complaints, nitpicks at best, are that you are given two melee weapons where one would suffice and the flashlight is replaced with nightvision goggles that brighten and dim the whole screen in an instant, which can be jarring when playing at night.
para mi es el mejor juego de la saga.

Picked up the Half life collection at he beginning of 2019's Steam Summer Sale since I had neglected them so far and have been playing through them since completing Half-Life 1 and both story expansions.

A short and great continued little story running in tandem with the original Half-Life with new weapons, new enemies, and generally just a good time. It of course suffers many of the problems I'm sure GoldSrc engine is known for, but they hardly hold the game back in that regard when the fun outshines nearly any frustration you may feel.

Recommended for sure!

If you're a fan of Half-Life, then you must play this expansion. The addition of new enemy types, weapons and characters really flesh out the canon of the first game, and gives a whole new perspective to the clusterf*** of the Black Mesa Resonance Cascade. Certainly competes with the original games atmosphere, and tries out new ideas to keep game-play fresh and exciting.
